synopsis:
"Your destiny does not require approval from anyone..." Takota - Just Another DreamWhen a fateful injury sparks an ordinary girl to have foretelling dreams, she is forced into a
race against time to save her family and prove her sanity....or is it JUST ANOTHER
DREAM? This Action/Drama is an inspirational story of believing in yourself, following
your dreams and never giving up!Anna Miller was an ordinary, small-town eight-year-old, until a fateful injury changed her life
forever, causing her to dream of things to come. At age fourteen, she dreams of a serious crime
before it is committed, but nobody believes that her nightmare has become a reality. Anna is
institutionalized, where she meets some quirky friends and a doctor that can't accept the
"impossible." Feeling hopeless, desperate and alone, she turns to her best friend Josh, who has a
shocking secret of his own. He confesses a regretful past that he would give anything to change.When Anna's "dreams" threaten the lives of her siblings, she refuses to accept this. We follow
Anna on an incredible journey, as she takes on fate and is pushed beyond her limits. With the
help of a mysterious mentor, who sees Anna's gift for what it truly is, she comes to discover the
true power that lies within. Anna ultimately learns that in times of life's deepest defeat, she must
believe in herself.Just as she thinks her mission of saving her family and proving her sanity is complete, Anna
finds herself waking up from her injury at eight years old and realizes she could single-handedly
change Josh's dark "past". She must follow the clues she was given while dreaming to complete
this new mission, which could be more than she bargained for, as it may require the ultimate
sacrifice. This family-friendly film delivers plenty of suspense and surprises that keep you
wondering what is real and it's sure to leave you with a powerful message you won't soon forget!
summary: When a fateful injury sparks an ordinary girl to have foretelling dreams, she is forced into a race against time to save her family and prove her sanity....or is it JUST ANOTHER DREAM? Action/Drama.

synopsis:
A group of tourists joins the riverboat "Queen" as it ventures far upriver on the Rio Negro, to visit indigenous villages and explore jungle habitats. But as the idyllic journey unfolds, a dark cloud of thievery and menace thunders aboard, shattering the voyage and threatening the passengers and crew with death. Ingenuity and resourcefulness are their only chance to survive.This captivating movie features breathtaking panoramic views of the Amazon - the eighth wonder of the world. AMAZON QUEEN was filmed entirely in the Amazon Rainforest along the Rio Negro, Manaus, Brazil, at the height of the Covid outbreak in October 2020. The director, Marlin Darrah, assembled for his movie a cast of talented actors including Carson Grant (One Penny), Massi Furlan (Jumanji, the Next Level), Alfonso DiLuca (CW-Jane the Virgin) and introducing Carly Diamond Stone and Nick Dreselly Thomas."With 86 minutes of adventure, drama, and action, AMAZON QUEEN inspires audiences throughout the world, to return to theaters to experience first-hand the enjoyment of viewing an exhilarating movie experience on the silver screen." - Peter Jordan, Los Angeles film critic"Romantic, Thrilling, & Exotic. This movie grabs hold and won't let go. Independent filmmaking at its best." - Paul Perry, New York Times Best-Selling writer.A festival favorite, AMAZON QUEEN has won 144 awards and nominations at 102 international awards events and festivals, for Best Feature Film, Best Drama, Best Thriller, Best Director, Best Lead Actress and Lead Actor, Best Supporting Actor, Best Young Actor, Best Sound, Best Cinematography, and Best Producers. Amazon Queen has distribution with Lise Romanoff, Vision Films.
Author: James Thompson
summary: A group of tourists joins the Amazon Forest riverboat "Queen" as it ventures upriver, to visit indigenous villages and explore jungle habitats. But a dark cloud of thievery and menace thunders aboard, threatening all with death.

There's a massive student loan crisis in America. Millions have found themselves buried beneath a mountain of debt. Entire generations are trapped. Borrowed Future uncovers the dark side of the student loan industry and exposes how the system is built to work against you. We meet a group of high school students as they're about to make one of the biggest financial decisions of their lives, and then the other side: the reality for adults living with student loan debt. Do 17-year-olds really understand their financial decisions today will affect the future in front of them? Borrowed Future proves that you really do have the power to beat the student loan system - but it's up to you. You get to decide to feed the system or fight back.—Ramsey Solutions [us]

13 years ago, Jane Arcs was condemned to death after brutally killing her opponent in a underground street fight. Now, in just 24 hours, Jane will be executed for her crime. Finding 52: The Search for the Loneliest Whale in the World is a feature length documentary that will take audiences on a journey to find the forgotten "52 Hertz Whale." In the summer of 2004, audiences looked on in disbelief as the Greek National Football Team, a country that had never previously won a single match in a major tournament, took down the giants of world football to become the unlikeliest of European Champions. The architect behind this unprecedented triumph was legendary German football coach 'King' Otto Rehhagel. After accomplishing every major success in Germany, he made the bold decision to leave all he knew behind and work in a foreign country with the underachieving Greek National Team. This is the story of how these two contrasting cultures came together to speak the same language and write a new chapter of Greek mythology.

synopsis: A pregnant mother, her daughter and her in-laws are playing a board game under candlelight trying to pass time during a blackout. They are interrupted when 5 men burst through the door wearing a distinctive dog tag with the letter "V" and the word "VEX" on the back, attacking them and killing them all under the direction of one man. The final killing is of the pregnant mother is given to a man named Tyson, as a test of his worth. He passes. Three months have passed since the incident. Michael Knight, a New York Police Department detective has gone rouge looking for the men who killed his family. He was released since he had a conflict of interest to the case. He hasn't been dealing well with the tragic loss of his pregnant wife Summer, and family, by the VEX.As Knight is driving in his car one day contemplating suicide, thinking about his past with his wife Summer, he notices a distant figure staggering down the highway. Always the cop, Knight pulls over to investigate the man who just collapsed from exhaustion and pain. Knight comes to his aid asking him if he needs help offering him food and the beer he has in his vehicle. Knight realizes that there is something interesting about this man. He notices the tag around his neck and realizes that he may be his connection to finding the individuals that murdered his family. Knight plays it cool, offering him a ride. The man reluctantly identifies himself as Tyson and Knight and eventually convinces him to give him a ride to New Jersey.Knight is able to put Tyson at ease as Tyson doesn't view Knight as a threat. Tyson seems to have been walking all night trying to escape his past. Tyson tells Knight that he is not a good man and he is on a journey to kill all the men that tried kill him and that he committed crimes with. He regrets how he has been living his life. Tyson tells Knight that he has a debt to repay. Knight finds this interesting that Tyson is trying to make amends for his crimes.On the way to Jersey Knight stops to get gas and as he is pumping gas tries to get more information out of Tyson, they are surprised when another member of the VEX attacks them out of nowhere. Tyson is able to defeat the member and they continue to journey to the club, Hunter's Point where the next VEX member is at. The gas attendant calls the cops and is met by NYPD Detective Mason and New Jersey State Police Detective Johnson. They are part of a joint task force to find the VEX who operate in both New York and New Jersey they are on the tail of Knight who they assume to be trying to track down the VEX members. The gas attendant points at the direction that Knight and Tyson went.Tyson and Knight enter the club called Hunter's Point. Knight heads to the bar while Tyson is scanning the club looking for his target. Once he spots Ray, the another Vex member, he attacks drawing the attention of security. Knight realizes this may prevent Tyson from getting to the other members and comes to his aid taking out the security. He finds himself in a little bit of trouble however and the beautiful woman in the club he was talking to comes to his aid. She seems very sympathetic towards his recent tragedy. Once Ray is defeated they leave the club in a hurry and head off toward the next location Tyson has in mind. Detective Mason and Johnson arrive moments later to the aftermath and are told by onlookers that they left the building. The detectives follow in pursuit. While in pursuit Johnson inquires why Mason treats him so harshly and challenges her to arrest Knight for his reckless behavior. Mason defends Knight and tells Detective Johnson that Knight's tragedy came as a result of a crooked politician turning in one more hit before he went prison at the hands of Knight. She also states that she would act the same way if she was in the same position.Tyson forces Knight to pull over as they are driving and let him continue alone as the last incident reminds him that he doesn't want to put anymore lives in danger. Knight insists that he will finish the fight with him. Tyson is hit with emotion as he reflects upon his past mistakes. He looks out the window and begins to recount the incident that made him desire to change his life. He is full of remorse as he describes the exact details of the night Knight's wife died. Furthermore, he reveals that he was the one who did it. Knight is losing it in the car and pulls a gun on Tyson. Unaware that he is moments away from being shot, Tyson continues to talk about the incident and tells Knight that he is ready to change his life and get revenge for the victims by killing the gang. After he promised to offer his life over to the man whose life he destroyed by murdering his wife and unborn child. Conflicted, Knight hears this and eventually puts the gun away realizing that he is close to locating the leader of the VEX and doesn't want to waste the opportunity.Knight and Tyson infiltrate the abandoned warehouse where Vader the leader of the VEX stays. Detective Mason and Johnson split up and follow them in gaining access as well. Upon entering they are confronted with resistance by some of the VEX guards on duty but they are able to overcome them in a small fire fight. Tyson calls out Vader but to his surprise and Vader appears with Floyd, another VEX member and he has Detective Mason at gun point. Knight is shocked at Mason's presence and Tyson now begins to realize through their interaction that the person that he was driving with all along is the cop that he owes his life to. Floyd forces them to drop their weapons. Detective Johnson enters the warehouse and gets the jump on Floyd, demanding Floyd drop the guns and calling for back up to save everyone but Floyd is a quick shooter and kills both Mason and Johnson before Mason can pull his trigger. Vader tells Floyd to get rid of the guns so that they can handle their differences by hand. Floyd accepts and Knight and Floyd go at it while Tyson and Vader go at it. They are both having a hard time but Knight and Tyson overcome the odds. Knight kills Floyd and joins forces with Tyson to kill Vader. Once they are defeated, Tyson kneels on the floor offering his life to Knight as promised. Knight picks up one of the guns and approaches Tyson. Struggling with the memories of the loss of his family but considering at what Tyson sacrificed to make things right in the present, Knight decides to forgive Tyson and disappears into the night.By Dwayne Parker
summary: A detective who lost everything that he loves. A product of the school to prison pipeline seeking redemption from his past. Two men from different sides of the law set out to take revenge on a common enemy when they unknowingly run into each other and realize that forgiveness may be their only salvation.—Dwayne Parker

What do you do, who do you turn to when you suspect your significant other of cheating? That's the question that plagued the mind of small town business owner Daniel. Fed up with the lack of affection Daniel decides to take matters into his own hands.

Sometimes hope is all you need, but sometimes it can be hard to find. Faced with the death of her beloved grandmother, Lizzy now focuses on the farm, her horses, and three-day eventing. With her upcoming marriage to James threatened and challenged by a beautiful girl from his past, Lizzy must learn to stand on her own two feet but with Legacy by her side she can do it. It's a competitive world but she's determined to make it work. Lizzy will need to conquer her bullies and overcome three competitions: show jumping, cross country, and dressage with her young horse, Legacy. Her manager is by her side all the way but her past catches up with her, and Lizzy needs to make a choice to stop it all or go for the gold.—Douglas B. Maddox

synopsis: Monsters and aliens roam on a desert-like planet. A portal of red light activates, and a ship flies through, emerging out of a mountainside and flying over a forest.Glen Craven (Tim Wade), and Lily Lantz (Emily Sweet), are young UFO investigators preparing to document the phenomenon of strange lights and reports of alien activity on Mount Adams, Washington. They speak at a UFO convention, outlining the plan for their next expedition and what they expect to find.The next day they head out, bringing along their camera crew and assistants. On the first day, they conduct interviews with the locals living around the mountain. They are warned to be careful of the red lights and what comes out of them.Before they head to the mountain they meet up with their guide, Ranger Bill Jefferson (Greg James). He takes them to a closed-off trail and tells them that no one is allowed farther up because people have been going missing. Determined to get as close to the phenomena as possible, Lily bribes the ranger to lead them up the mountain.The trail quickly deteriorates until there is no clear path to follow. The team accuses Ranger Bill of being lost, but he assures them that he knows the way. That night they set up camp and the team heads up to a rocky peak to get some footage. They observe the lights, which look like a portal, and the cameraman Blake (Phillip Wade) catches an alien ship on camera.The excited team trek back down to camp, where they discover that Bill is missing. One of the team members, Kim, (Allesondra Helwig) finds Bill's shoe...but it's bloody. The team's radios can't reach anyone off the mountain, so they decide to hunker down for the night and look for Bill in the morning.The next morning Glen and his assistant Thomas (Matthew O'Donnell) find Bill's body. It looks like he was torn apart by an animal. The team panics. They don't know the way back, but they make the decision to pack up and head down the mountain without their guide.An alien bug crosses their path and bites Kim's leg. Thomas kills the creature.They set up camp for a second night. They joke around the fire until a clawed arm lunges out of the darkness and grabs Blake by the shoulder. He's dragged off into the woods, and his girlfriend Candie (Alysse Fozmark) gives chase a short way, screaming. Her screams draw the monster away from Blake but lead it to her. Candie is killed and dragged off into the woods. Blake is far from his team and lost in the night.In the morning what remains of the team pull themselves together and head out again. By nightfall they are still lost, so they set up camp with a cliff at their backs. Glen stays up on watch but starts to nod off. Three alien monsters close in on them while he sleeps. Glen wakes up just in time to spear one in the eye with a sharpened stick before it can grab him. The monsters leave, and the team waits until morning to leave.Meanwhile, Blake is out in the woods alone, searching for his team.Kim's leg is worse. She looks like she's fading. The team carries her as they try to find their way home. When the sun starts to set, Glen and Thomas search for a safe campsite. Thomas engages Glen in horseplay, causing him to slip off a cliffside. Glen's shoulder is wounded after he rolls to the base of the cliff. Shortly after, Thomas sees an old hunter's cabin and leaves Glen to get Lily and Kim.Blake is prepping to survive another night in the woods alone when he sees a red light in the distance. Thinking it's his team, he sets out toward it.The team is safe in the cabin as the sun sets, but Kim is still fading. Darkness falls. The three monsters appear, closing in on the cabin.Blake finds the source of the light and discovers it's not his team's campfire. It's an alien portal. Mesmerized, he steps through it and disappears.The team sets up a watch for the night, and Thomas goes first. He falls asleep. A monster attacks the cabin, waking him up and causing him to fall to the floor, where he then scrambles under the bed. The rest of the team wakes, and Thomas discovers three guns in his hiding spot, which he quickly hands to Glen and Lily.The monsters surround the cabin while Glen, Lily, and Thomas take aim through the window. Lily kills one of the monsters and the other two briefly retreat. The second monster leaps onto the roof and begins pulling up shingles, forming a hole. Glen and Lily shoot it and it falls to the ground, where Glen finishes it off.The last monster comes for them, but they are out of ammo. The team frantically searches the cabin and finds three sticks of dynamite. They form a desperate plan - they'll light the dynamite in the cabin and run out, hoping that it will blow up the monster once they're at a safe distance.The last monster charges at the cabin. Lily lights the dynamite, then the team dashes out the cabin door, supporting Kim. They run to the tree line and look back. The monster rips boards off the window...and finally, the dynamite explodes. The last monster is dead.The team keeps walking until they find an old forest road. They follow it down the mountain, toward safety and survival.
summary: A team of UFO investigators find themselves fighting for survival as alien monsters hunt them on the slopes of Mount Adams.

synopsis:
As a very young teen in 1970, I saw Valerie Taylor, her late husband Ron and fellow Australian Rodney Fox for the first time, in the classic documentary "Blue Water, White Death." I was already hooked to the beauty of the underwater world, but it was here that these 3 inspired my love for Sharks and I followed in their footsteps with my lifelong fight to protect these magnificent creatures.
In this new epic documentary "Playing With Sharks", Valerie takes us on an amazing journey into her own teen years as a spearfishing champion, her romance with the sea and also with Ron, who made her his underwater model and later his wife. We see the couple embarking on an expedition that changed their lives forever. From spearfishing champions, they soon became world famous for their filming and production of underwater documentaries.
The Taylors traveled around the world filming sharks and educating the general public about the huge misconception that these awesome creatures are mindless killing machines in a time when sharks were labelled as Man-eaters following the release of "Jaws". They became protectors and defenders of our oceans and the creatures that live in it.
Their hard work soon started giving rewards as Australia became the first country in the world to protect the Grey Nurse Shark (Carcharias taurus). This was later followed by conservation measures for: the Potato Cod (Grouper) and Cod hole, The Sea lions, the Coral Sea bird breeding islands, the main breeding grounds of the Southern Right Whales becoming a marine reserve and also protection of the Great White Shark.This amazing woman's incredible lifelong journey is not over yet as Valerie, now 85, and following Ron's death in 2012, is still involved in conservation issues and still dives to spend time surrounded by and Playing With Sharks.
summary: Pioneering scuba diver Valerie Taylor, who has dedicated her life to exposing the myth surrounding our fear of sharks.

synopsis:
A global conflict is coming. When President Helen Colton (Wendy Hartman) arrived at the G-7 summit in Brussels, Belgium she was facing an international crisis with Russia's annexation of Crimea. But no sooner did she land when Elisabeth Seward (Stephanie Eaton), her National Security Advisor, informed her that General John Reager (Paul Noonan), the Commander of Air Force Space Command, wanted an immediate unscheduled meeting.As Colton and Seward secretly descend into a nearby bunker, Reager is reviewing the slide presentation he is about to give to the leader of the free world with the assistance of Major Ellen Sampson (Patience McStravick) of Space and Missile Systems Center. But just as Reager advises Sampson on the nuances of Presidential diplomacy, their stoic world is interrupted by Cedric Yonah (Conor Timmis), accompanied by James Griffin (Chris Goodwin). Incensed by the intrusion of a civilian, Reager's start of an interrogation falls short when Colton arrives and takes command of the moment.Awkward introductions present Yonah as a science advisor to Colton. But Reager immediately locks horns with the mysterious Yonah who comes across as neither present nor absent. Was it Yonah's mid-thirties looks, Nehru styled suit and flagrant disrespect that bothered Reager or was it is Reager's four-star uniform that represented military power and overconfidence that offset Yonah?
With time short Colton instructs Reager to get on with his presentation. In military precision with each passing slide, Reager builds to the moment of revelation - an alien satellite is parked at LaGrange Point 2 (a point in space where the gravity of moon, earth and sun creates an equilibrium point and allows a satellite to just hang there and observe the 2 space bodies). Discovered when Sampson's unit intercepted an alien signal through a military satellite (coming from LaGrange Point 2), the decoded signal reveals all Earth orbiting satellites (3500 satellites orbiting the Earth, plus over 500,000 pieces of space debris), military and civilian air traffic (more than 100,000 flights each yr) and weather forecasting models. But its greatest reveal-a flight plan of an unknown aircraft. The aliens are already here.
Reagar reveals that he had sent an experimental spacecraft towards LaGrange 2, which took pics of the extra-terrestrial satellite sending the signal. But the satellite retreated (it had anti gravity propulsion systems) when the earth space craft approached, and is untraceable since then. All this happened in Aug, its June of the following yr now.James Griffin leaves the meeting at this point.
Shocked by its revelation, Colton's attempts to learn more results in a confrontation between Reager and Yonah who are both protecting their worlds. Ellen continues to say that the alien satellite continues to send signals via x-ray transmission to Earth. These signals terminated in the Atlantic ocean and have no apparent receiver. Yonah argues that the alien craft could have been in orbit for a yr or for a 1000 yrs.
But what world is Yonah protecting? When an exasperated Reager literally orders Colton to sign a worldwide surveillance order to track down this alien presence, Yonah erupts into an impassioned plea citing world history and the oppression of millions based on fear of the unknown.
Reager argues that the war has already begun, while Yonah argues that the aliens are simply watching the humans. So this is a time for observation and learning, not war.
The speech falls cold on Reager who dismisses Yonah as a pacifist. A reluctant Colton signs OPERATION Troy giving Reager near unlimited resources and funding to identify this alien threat. Upon signing, it's Seward and Sampson that see Yonah go blank as he relives the horrors and sounds of a war fought over seventy years ago-a war he was in.As the meeting disbands, a dejected Yonah accepts a ride by an empathetic Sampson under a previous order by Reager to learn more about him. As Reager leaves, Colton finds herself alone with Seward and informs her that she's been aware of an alien presence on Earth since she assumed office. A stunned Seward follows Colton's instructions to have two other world leaders (Prime Minister Allison Colby (Lindy Nettleton) of the UK and President Sergei Tupolov (Yefim Somin) of Russia) join her to implement a plan to stop Reager before he inadvertently starts a war of biblical proportions. She says she signed the order as she feared a plot by Reager to use this ploy to wrest military control away from civilian hands.
Colton reveals that she knew Yonah is an alien and has been on Earth for several yrs. Colton knows that both sides of the conflict now know each other and are set for conflict. She also knows that public opinion is against the aliens, even if the aliens have been humanity's friend for decades (and across the 2 world wars).. Colton tries to figure out how to support the aliens without letting Hadrian or Reager know, or dismissing them.Reager goes to a Belgian air base and reports to Senator Paul Hadrian (Michael Anthony Coppola). Apparently Reager was working on behalf of Hadrian. Hadrian is reviewing footage from Reager's meeting with the president, which shows Yonah as a blur, while everyone else is clearly visible. It is implied that Yonah is the alien.
Hadrian and Reager discuss the development of prototype planes that can fly fast enough to catch up with alien space craft. Hadrian also plans to use intelligence from TROY to shape his Presidential bid in the upcoming elections to defeat Colton.With OPERATION Troy now implemented, a nervous Yonah directs Sampson not to an airfield, but an actual field. As they awkwardly exit her vehicle and begin a slow methodical walk, Yonah attempts to recruit Sampson in a vain attempt for assistance to find his missing people and to defy Reager. He claims that he was the one who sent the signal and the signal did not come from deep space. He also questions Sampson on how Reager had the knowledge to Decrypt the signal in the first place.
Bewildered, angry and fearing a plot, Sampson states the she cannot pledge allegiance to Yonah on his words alone. Yonah reveals that 1947 was the Roswell incident and 1972 was when the Apollo mission was ended. he reveals that his species got involved with Earth after WW II, as Earth technology was not progressing fast enough. The aliens wanted a back-up for their technology and knowledge. So, Yonah joined the German rocket effort at Peenemunde. When he learned what the German's were up to, he stopped, and was sent to a concentration camp. After the war, the German rocket engineers went to US to work on the Apollo program.
The aliens developed surveillance technology to keep an eye on humans and that's when one of their planes went down in Roswell. Humans reached the moon in 1969, and first contact was made then. Aliens were supposed to meet UNSC in 1972, to reveal their existence, but the military never brought them to that meeting. Those aliens were Yonah's parents and he has been searching for them ever since. He tells Sampson that US military has enough nukes to destroy the world 10 times over as they know they are not alone and are paranoid. and now Reager will build an surveillance network to end humanity as we know it.It is in that moment than an unknown aircraft (looks like an oversized SR-71 Blackbird) reveals itself. Shocked and confused, Sampson's attempt to understand begs her to ask "Where are you from?" When Yonah responds "Earth" he hopes Sampson's confusion abates with a gift that only NASA can authenticate - the plaque from Apollo 11 that states - we came in peace for all mankind. No sooner does she look up to thank him and a warping of air is all that's left of Yonah and the mysterious aircraft.
summary: When Air Force Space Command receives a signal from an alien satellite in Earth orbit an emergency meeting with the President reveals a government conspiracy.

synopsis: The 'Southland Dog Killer,' who previously killed only pets, murders online beauty influencer Genelle in the bathroom during a cosmetics promotion. In light of events, social media star Mia Larson cancels her livestream plans with friends Lani, Jade, and Santi to watch her sister Nicole's dog Chico instead. Meanwhile, Nicole supposedly travels to San Francisco to undergo treatment for Livingston's Disease, a hereditary brain condition that killed Nicole and Mia's mother.While ignoring Chico, Mia repeatedly receives unsettling texts and phone calls from Nicole's neighbor Kellan. Using disturbing videos, Kellan reveals he kidnapped Nicole, Mia's friends, and Chico. Kellan proves he will torture Mia's friends if she tries to leave or call the police. Kellan forces Mia to answer questions, perform tasks, and make choices between who lives and who dies as part of a sick game. Chico seemingly dies when Mia chooses Lani over the dog. Mia also chooses Lani over Nicole.Lani finally calls Mia and explains that everything was an elaborate prank that Lani livestreamed to Mia's followers. Lani reveals she is in the attic, Jade and Santi are in a vacant house next door, and the real Kellan was never involved.Mia becomes incensed by everyone's callousness, particularly when she discovers Lani exploited footage of Nicole crying at their mother's funeral. Her newly shaken mental state compels Mia to call her sister and apologize for abandoning Nicole to care for their dying mother alone.Lani calls back with a warning that someone else is in the house, which Mia doesn't believe. Someone kills Lani. Santi calls to tell Mia he is locked inside the other house. Fed up with the apparent prank and unable to find her stolen keys, Mia calls a rideshare and is paired with a driver named Big Mike.Mia realizes it is no longer a prank when she finds Lani dead in the pool. Someone identified as Kellan texts Mia and forces her to give herself painful injections. Mia finds Santi suffocated.Jade calls Mia. Jade claims Lani paid her and Santi a lot of money to participate in the prank. However, Kellan sends a video proving Lani was actually broke and worked at Whole Foods, and only pretended to be posh online.Mia finds her mother's corpse in a closet. Nicole enters the house to reveal she was behind everything all along, including the initial setup with the dog deaths. Nicole explains that she tormented Mia because she felt her sister was selfish when it came to their family, which was additionally proven by Mia ignoring the dog and choosing Lani over Nicole.Nicole shows a video proving she smothered their mother on her deathbed. Mia tries telling Nicole that she suffers from the same mental sickness that runs in their family.Nicole threatens to stab Jade unless Mia breaks her legs. Mia bashes one of her legs with a baseball bat and tries breaking the other by jumping over a banister. Nicole kills Jade anyway.Nicole lies on the floor beside her sister. Nicole accuses Mia of presenting a false personality online, and says she never believed Mia would care for her like Mia once promised.The real Kellan comes to the front door. Nicole shoots Kellan when he gets suspicious.Mia uses the opportunity to turn the tables on her sister. While their confrontation continues livestreaming to her followers, Mia knocks Nicole unconscious. Mia limps outside and collapses on the sidewalk. Having pulled up in his car, Big Mike asks if she is Mia. Mia replies, "No." Livestream viewers see that Nicole is still alive.(copied from culturecrypt)

synopsis: Struggling vampire romance novelist Olivia Romo is spending her Christmas holidays alone at her deceased mother's cabin in Lake Tahoe. One night, an injured bat slams against her window. Olivia takes the wounded animal inside her garage to nurse it back to health. The next morning, Olivia is surprised to discover that the bat has transformed into a handsome vampire named Luke. Olivia stocks up on pig's blood from the local butcher to feed her new house guest and soon the weakened vampire is up on his feet and talking. The unlikely companions get to know each other and start to form a tenuous friendship, but Olivia grows suspicious of Luke's intentions as his past begins to catch up with him. Vampire hunter Julius King visits Olivia posing as a private investigator and tells her he's looking for a trio of dangerous criminals, one of them being Luke. Olivia covers for Luke, but King sees right through her lies. He attempts to seize Luke by force, only to be killed in the process. Luke attempts to mend his shaky relationship with Olivia by giving her feedback on her book. Just as he's gotten back into her good graces, his vampire friends Jackie and Brock arrive on the scene, implying that he's strayed too far from his ruthless vampire roots and must kill Olivia. Jackie and Brock invade Olivia's home on Christmas Eve and Olivia barely escapes with her life in King's abandoned SUV. While the vampires go on a late night killing spree, Olivia learns the horrible truth about Luke's past from King's records. Olivia calls one of King's associates, Simon, who advises her not to attempt to deal with the dangerous vampires herself. Nevertheless, on Christmas morning, Olivia returns to her cabin and fights the vampires, killing Brock and Jackie by impaling them through the heart. Olivia then shoots Luke with a crossbow, seemingly killing him as well. Ten months later, Olivia is a successful author of vampire fiction. Following a book signing in Los Angeles, Olivia returns to her cabin where she has imprisoned the barely living Luke in her garage, forcing him to be her muse in exchange for blood.
summary: A struggling vampire romance novelist must defend herself against real-life vampires during Christmas in Lake Tahoe.
A man will become a criminal to save his family.

synopsis: A young New York City journalist, frustrated with the pressures of a failing publishing world and a less-than-promising romantic life, is sent on a journey of self-improvement with catastrophic consequences.Driven by success, social status, and being the life and soul of the party, Parker Schafer is thrown off the rails when her longtime boyfriend kicks her out of their apartment, to return to the arms of his ex-wife. Parker's reputation is in shambles and she is fired, destroying her seemingly perfect glamorous life.Upon the suggestion of a friend, Parker decides to give a viral wellness retreat a try. The famed Guru Shuroo promises "7 days to change your life." Parker packs up her life in the concrete jungle and heads out to the remote getaway in the Catskills.Picked up by a spiritual bohemian in a classic VW van, a diverse group of backstories and unlikely friends are brought together for a weekend none of them could have expected.Meditation, yoga, journaling, and of course mescaline trips and fraud, are the recipes to this whirlwind of a wellness retreat.Will Parker experience the redemption she requires? What she discovers about herself and The Guru Shuroo fuels their return to New York City and the new spotlight they have both found themselves in.The Shuroo Process seeks to expose the dangers of the 'personal discovery weekend' and the difficulties of falling prey to over-hyped promises of transformation. In truth, the self-help industry is a mere band-aid on the deep psychological wounds of our society.
summary: When a young NYC based freelance magazine writer, frustrated with the pressures of a failing publishing world and a less than promising romantic life, becomes infatuated by a wildly charismatic self-help guru it sends her on a journey of self improvement with catastrophic consequences.

By day, Ed Popil worked as the manager of a telemarketing center in post-industrial Rochester, New York for 18 years. By night, he transformed into drag queen Mrs. Kasha Davis. Not your average aspiring pop star drag queen, Mrs. Kasha Davis is a 1960's era housewife trying to liberate herself from domestic toil through performing at night in secret - an homage to Ed's own mother. After seven years of auditioning to compete on reality television show RuPaul's Drag Race, Ed Popil was finally cast onto the show and thrust into a full time entertainment career at the late age of 44. Workhorse Queen explores the complexities of mainstream television's impact on queer performance culture. In addition to following Ed's life and career before and after being cast onto RuPaul's Drag Race, the film focuses on the growing divide between members of a small town drag community - those who have been on television, and those who have not. Throughout the film, Ed Popil navigates the exciting highs and devastating lows of pursuing the fame promised by a reality television platform. With one foot inching toward Hollywood's doorstep and the other cemented firmly within her beloved Rochester community, Mrs. Kasha Davis finds a surprising new audience at home as she works toward becoming the queer role model for children that Ed didn't have and desperately wanted growing up.

synopsis:
The film delves into Justin Bieber's personal life and follows him as he prepares for his New Year's Eve show on December 31, 2020 on the rooftop of the Beverly Hilton hotel. The concert was attended by 240 fans and live-streamed around the world. The film also includes self-shot footage by Bieber and his wife Hailey. Ratner previously directed Bieber's music video for "Intentions", and the documentary series Justin Bieber: Seasons (2020).This is his first show in 3 yrs and conducted with full Covid-19 protocols. Justin shot his own footage to keep camera crews to a minimum. He starts the day with a walk with Hailey.
At the concert, There are issues as live-stream doesn't work (too many people try to log on at the same time). Concert kicks off at 8 : 45 pm
Guests at the hotel watch from their balconies to maintain distance.DEcember was worst month for the pandemic in US. Cases were rising and all music and concerts were on hold. Given the lack of open venues, Justin attempted to host the concert on the roof of the Beverly Hilton in LA and stream it live to 150 countries. Chris Gratton is the show designer and producer.
30 days to concert and the roof has a weight restriction, since it was built in the 1950's. So, they had to design a large structure, which was also very light.
Candace is the safety officer and the Covid officer. A tight bubble was maintained.28 days to concert. Nick DeMoura is the creative director. Rehearsals starts. No rehearsals at the hotel, as that will give away the show. Nick started as a back up dancer in Justin's group and rose up to become his choreographer. Justin is very loyal to his group and some of them have been with him for over 10 yrs. Lauren Walters is the Director of Operations and Security (he has been with Justin for 11 yrs now). Bernard "Harv" Harvey is also a long time dancer in Justin's group
Rory Kramer is the Videographer. Over time Justin has walked into a leadership role to keep the group together and working in sync towards a singular goal. Justin was a child when he started and has since grown into a man, and then became a husband.
Justin is shown as really committed to his family. He feels safe in his inner circle of family and friends.26 days to concert. First rehearsals on stage. Band and dancers together.
21 days to concert and Nick DeMoura tests positive for Covid. He has to quarantine for 14 days and miss rehearsals. He works from home and sends notes to the team to practice. Enter crew has to get tested every morning. There is no other work, so everybody is really respectful about the Covid rules.
14 days to concert. Nick is still recovering from home. the stage is transferred to the hotel. 8 days to go and the stage goes up on the roof. Nick joins the group back. They get go ahead for using Pyro tech on stage at the show.6 days to concert and a thunder and lightening shower hits LA. So, now the crew has to delay prep by one day.
0 days to concert. show day. Hailey uses humidifiers in the room before sleeping so Justin wakes up with a clear throat. 12 hrs to the show, as Justin goes for the walk with Hailey. Justin wants to have a kid in 2021, Hailey is not too sure. Every ounce on stage has been accounted for, so that they don't over burden the structure of the hotel. Drones are deployed for filming and security.
Justin selects his wardrobe for the stage. Pants, shirts, hoodies, shoes and jewelry.. Everything is carefully selected. 45 mins before the show, there are dramas with the live-stream and the show is pushed out by an hour. It has to end by 10 PM (as per cut off guidelines of local admin).. The IT team cannot give a real estimate of when of the problem with the servers will be fixed.
Decision is made to go at 8 45 pm, no matter what. The concert completes without a hitch. It takes a lot of people to put together a show. The crew celebrates new years at the hotel.
summary: Lead-up to Justin Bieber's first full concert in three years and his New Year's Eve show in 2020 on the rooftop of the Beverly Hilton.

synopsis:
In the opening scene, a young employee named Keith sneaks into the dark warehouse of Brooke's Hardware Store on a mission to uncover secrets. With a bright-red lantern in hand, he climbs a tall ladder to investigate a mysterious noise. Before he is able to finish his search, he is attacked by an unknown force and knocked off the ladder. His fate is unknown.Later at Brooke's Hardware Store, the impatient and overbearing general manager named Brian desperately pressures Gene, the exuberant assistant manager, to hire anybody to help out during the Black Friday season, insisting it does not matter who it is.Then, Sam Coleman, an anxious young man, attempts to apply for a job in a drive-thru line, but is comically rejected. He sits in his car, giving up hope of ever finding a job, when suddenly his phone rings. Gene offers Sam a job at Brooke's Hardware Store, which Sam gleefully accepts.Sam rushes to Brooke's, where Gene shows him a training video and gives him a tour. During the tour, Gene and Sam find Brian suspiciously locking the warehouse that Keith entered in the opening scene. Gene brushes it off, and then introduces Sam to a sarcastic coworker named Sarah, who quickly trains Sam and shows him that she does not take her job very seriously. Sam spends his first shift alone on the register. He then realizes how easy the job is going to be and definitively decides to keep the position.The next morning, Sam returns and joyfully works his shift, eventually meeting a strange and awkward coworker named Bill. He bonds with Sarah in the break room, revealing to her that he is in community college and eventually wants to transfer to medical school. Sarah warns Sam that Brooke's is a creepy store, and he should not let the job take over his life. As if to prove Sarah's point, later that evening Sam finds Gene creepily staring at a wall in his office while the lights flicker ominously. Sam is freaked out, and he leaves his shift feeling uneasy.However, the next morning, Gene arrives at work in a jolly mood, which eases Sam's fears. Working in a new section, Sam tries to locate Sarah, but finds a strange pile of bubbling black goo instead. Later, Brian finds Sam and orders him to finish out his shift in the gardening section. There, Sam encounters a creepy customer, who is not moving in the aisle. Sam tries to talk to him, but the creepy customer does not speak back, and attempts to grab Sam's walkie-talkie. Sarah rescues Sam and warns him that she sees the same strange customer always hanging around, and he should be avoided. Sam's fears about Brooke's continue to grow.During his next shift, Sam tries to see if the creepy customer is still there, but instead finds another puddle of black goo. Attempting to find something to clean up the goo, Sam wanders into an eerie supply closet lit by a piercing red light. Sam finds a journal written by an old employee, which is full of messages warning about the hidden evils of Brooke's. Sam shows the journal to Sarah, who realizes it was written by Keith, her old coworker who mysteriously disappeared from work. After some debate, they decide to break into Gene's office to find Keith's employee file and figure out what happened, but find that Keith's file is empty.
Then, Bill surprisingly informs them that Brian hides secret files in a closet near his office. Despite Sarah telling Sam to wait for her, Sam decides to explore the closet by himself. After finding the closet locked, Sam is caught by Brian, who threatens to fire him for sneaking around. Sam is shaken by the encounter, and has an emotional moment with Sarah. However, Gene cheers Sam up by offering him a full time position at Brooke's.The following day, Sam tells Sarah that he wants to accept Gene's offer. Sarah tells him not to throw his life away working at such a miserable job. They argue, but when they are stopped by Gene, Sam spitefully accepts his full time offer in front of Sarah. Sarah angrily reveals to Gene that they sneaked into his office to figure out what happened to Keith, but Gene reassures them that nothing is wrong by showing them Keith's file. It says that Keith received minor injuries from his fall but is otherwise unharmed. Sam cowardly takes no responsibility for also breaking into Gene's office, so Gene writes a report to Brian about Sarah breaking the rules.The next morning, Bill shocks Sam by revealing that he overheard Brian firing Sarah over the phone. Sam confronts Brian about it, but Brian only mocks him. Sam is infuriated and decides to attempt to find out what is in the secret closet again. He pays Bill to distract Brian, and steals Brian's keys to the secret closet. He breaks in, and to his horror, he finds Keith's real file which reveals the truth: Keith was killed on the job and Brian covered it up. Sam is horrified, and he hatches a plan to destroy Brooke's for all of its corruption.With Gene's backup, Sam convinces Brian to let him be in charge of the store for Black Friday. Brian miserably explains to the whole crew on the morning of Black Friday that they have to hit a certain quota, or the store will go under. Just as the Black Friday rush is at its peak, Sam's plan begins. He tells Bill and a new set of temp workers hired by Brian to go home, and then sabotages Gene working at the register. Enraged, Gene horrifically scratches his own face, scaring Sam and the remaining customers. Gene runs away to his office as all the customers rush out of the store, leaving Sam to celebrate his victory taking down the corrupt Brooke's Hardware.The film then cuts to a flashback showing more of what happened in the opening scene. Keith is revealed confronting Brian in his office, attempting to put an end to Brooke's Hardware Store's corruption, just like Sam. He steals Brian's keys, locking him in his office, and enters the warehouse to find proof of Brian's wrongdoing. Keith is now seen from Brian's perspective being pushed off the ladder and killed by mysterious figures. Brian screams at Keith to stop, but he is too late. He sobs to himself.In the present day, Brian confronts Sam about sabotaging Black Friday. As he yells at Sam, the film cuts back and forth to Gene in his office, staring at the wall again in an inhuman way. Brian tells Sam that he is not the evil one, that all he has ever done is try to keep his employees safe. Gene then screams at the wall to tell him what to do. Brian tells Sam that he only fired Sarah to keep her safe, as she would have been punished if she discovered the truth. Then, as Gene is sitting in silence, he finally hears something communicate back to him. He then listens as the wicked voice of the Brooke's loudspeaker announcer supernaturally gives him instructions from behind the wall, and he becomes ecstatic and exits his office.Brian worriedly gives Sam his keys. As Brian screams at Sam to keep the doors locked and "keep feeding them," Gene appears, and brutally murders Brian with a hammer. Gene hits the chains off of the warehouse and shadowed figures drag Brian's body into the warehouse. Absolutely terrified, Sam runs for his life, until he encounters the creepy customer from earlier, and yells at him to get out of the store for his safety. However, Gene appears, and reveals that the customer is on his side, and he begs Sam to join them. Confused and terrified, Sam slashes at the customer with his box cutter as he walks towards him. The same black goo that Sam had found in the store earlier leaks out of the customer's hand. Sam realizes the customer is not human, and he slashes the creature's neck, killing him.Gene is enraged, and screams at the store for help. Suddenly, dozens of mysterious demonic creatures emerge from behind the walls, and chase down Sam with Gene at the lead. Sam finds refuge in the closet lit by the red light, which seems to repel Gene and the creatures. Sam begs for an explanation, and Gene goes on to tell him that he has been guiding a group of lost demonic souls by growing new bodies for them in exchange for his own power. He explains they all have been feeding off the store for decades, but now that Brian is dead and Brooke's will go bankrupt, they will be free to escape into the world and conquer anything in their path. He tells Sam that if he gives them the keys to set them free, he can join them and live an eternal life of purpose. Sam is about to comply out of fear, but then remembers his human bond with Sarah and his desire to fight for himself. He refuses to give up the keys. But Gene runs to the power grid to turn off the red light. Thinking quickly, Sam fashions a lantern with the red light bulb like Keith did, keeping himself safe even without power. Gene runs into the room to kill Sam, but Sam ignites the lantern, and slashes Gene's throat. Gene falls to the ground and dies. Now surrounded by the creatures, Sam leaves Sarah a voicemail, apologizing for not sticking up for her and resolving to fight his way out in the face of death.Finding a hidden pool of courage, Sam grabs an ax and easily kills all of the demons in a rock 'n' roll montage, who are much weaker than they appear. Victorious, Sam hobbles out of Brooke's and says his final goodbyes to the defeated store. However, as he is exiting, one final demon runs out into the street. But Sarah is waiting outside after hearing Sam's voicemail, and kills the demon with a baseball bat. Sam and Sarah reconnect and celebrate, having finally taken down the evil of Brooke's Hardware Store. They light the store on fire, and look forward to the endless possibilities of life. The film ends with a page in Keith's journal that reads "We did it, Keith," catching fire, as Sam and Sarah cheer at the store being engulfed in flames.
summary: After starting a job at an eerie hardware store, an anxious young man uncovers a shocking mystery that leads to a fight against terrifying forces that lurk just behind the walls.
A sassy bounty hunter and her convict boyfriend free a society from the clutches of a repressive theocratic police state.

A madcap romp through the 1980's NYC art scene amid the colorful career of painter, Edward Brezinski, hell-bent on making it. Filmed in NYC, Detroit, San Francisco, Ireland, Berlin and the Cote d'Azur.

synopsis: There has never been a movie produced quite like "The Hike". The film is based on three true stories. Two are based on the wild adventures of the producer's brother: a hiker who frequents the Great Smoky Mountains. The third story is based on the production company's own experiences: Big N Funky Productions' own possible run in with an infamous Native American legend while filming one of their paranormal TV shows.The movie starts off with one of the most unique horror movie intros ever: two scenes, deep in the wilderness, showing two different murders, one playing forward and one playing in reverse.The movie's main characters, Robin and Vinnie, are introduced next. They are driving into the remote forest for a three day hike. Robin is 3/4 Native American, and wants to show her boyfriend, Vinnie, a place in the National Park that was special to her when she was a little girl. Vinnie is obviously uncomfortable in the woods, but he is trying to be a decent guy. Vinnie starts clowning around, telling funny stories and trying to have a good time despite his disdain for the outdoors, when they start running into odd things in the woods.Robin finds a polaroid picture of a partially naked, bound woman with her face marked out. As disturbing as that is, they soon find other things in the woods that throws them off even more: an abandoned camera that contains disturbing images, more Polaroids of naked, bound people, an ancient necklace with a mysterious aura, and a stranger in the forest that seems to know them, but then vanishes.Things start to get surreal for the couple after they eat some potent 'shrooms before bedtime. Robin, dressed in Native regalia, appears before Vinnie and leads him to a cliff face where he almost falls off before being saved by another stranger. When they reunite on the main trail, Robin swears this was not her. The couple tries to find help from a forest ranger as more victims die in other parts of the forest and unidentified men are spying on nearly their every move.Robin and Vinnie stumble upon the Cherokee word U'tlun'ta written in blood in an abandoned cabin. Robin panics at first, but when she calms down she tells Vinnie about a Cherokee legend named Spearfinger: a rock golem with a long, obsidian finger that can shapeshift, manipulate nature, and eats her victim's livers after piercing their sides. This does not affect Vinnie, who assures her that things are gonna be OK.Eventually, a group of three, well armed, large men approach and threaten Robin and Vinnie at their campsite. The three men steal back the camera Robin found, and then the two groups separate after a heated discussion. Robin and Vinnie assume these three strangers are the reason for the disturbing Polaroids and try to hightail out of the woods.After a few hours, two of the three strangers, Luke and Travis, decide they need to follow Robin and Vinnie again and give chase. Robin and Vinnie have several close calls with them but successfully slip into a cave to hide. The couple spend the night in the cave, but once again, someone or something that resembles Robin appears to Vinnie and leads him off deeper into the cave on his own, leaving Robin in the cave by herself, with no flashlight. With everyone discombobulated, scared, angry, and at their wit's end, the final fight between good and evil takes place in the Great Smoky Mountains begging the question: Who will survive "The Hike?"Critics have noted the beautiful scenery, wildly unpredictable plot, the humor, the dialogue and the tension. But "The Hike" is probably best described as, as one reviewer stated, " Clerks in a horror movie set in the woods." In addition to tension, gore, mystery, comedy, adult situations and the paranormal, the film features the longest four person fight scenes in cinematic history.
summary: A couple from East Tennessee goes on a three day hike in the Great Smoky Mountains. The fun starts to dissipate when they start finding evidence of possible criminal activity scattered throughout the trails, and the deeper they plunge into the wilderness, the more they feel like they are being watched. Things take a turn for the worse when the couple runs into a trio of intimidating strangers. Their intentions are unclear, and the couple tries everything to escape the woods before violence ensues with their new adversaries. Eventually, another source of terror reveals itself, building up to the final fight between good and evil.—Val Dean Pouncie
A far-ranging look at the biases in how we see things, focusing on the use of police body cameras.

synopsis:
Doug Butler is a hardscrabble Vermont dairy farmer with an offbeat passion - dog mushing.A veritable folk hero, Doug's ease with cows, dogs and people is a joy to behold. And when he trains his team of mutts on the
family farm with a dream to compete at the world championships in Alaska, his teenage exuberance seems to erase the tired
lines on his sixty-five year old face.Yet the demands of being a small-scale family farmer in a changing world are constant, and Doug has never once left his cows
for more than a few days. And behind the charming cocktail of racy anecdotes and repeated jokes is a darker picture than Doug
would ever choose to reveal.Keenly aware of the fate of the other family farms that used to dot the landscape, Doug has managed for years to play one
creditor off against the next to survive another season. But with the accumulated debt now insurmountable and Doug's
thoughts plunging into depression and suicide, his dogs offer solace. And perhaps a way out.On a cold March morning Doug pulls out of his driveway in a rusted-out truck carrying 22 dogs, tearily waving goodbye to the
only world he's ever known. He's bound for Alaska. The journey will prepare him for what he'll confront when he gets back-the
sale of his farm and a race to craft a new destiny.Meticulously captured over the course of a decade, UNDERDOG paints an intimate vérité portrait of Doug Butler as he puts
a curiously optimistic twist on the kinds of family farm tragedies that have so marked American rural life. In the era of the
pandemic, the resonance of Doug's journey extends to all who have faced down loneliness, isolation and the struggle to make
sense of forces beyond control.
summary: The curiously optimistic story of Doug Butler-a hardscrabble Vermont dairy farmer who risks losing the only home he's ever known to chase his dreams of dog mushing in Alaska.

summary: Growing up in a small rural farm town in the early 1950's, sixteen- year-old Jimmy Hoffer, and his two siblings do their best to survive poverty and a crumbling family unit. With the mysterious death of his father, Jimmy's mother, Agnes, becomes disconnected to her children and finds refuge in the local bars and the men who visit them. She selfishly falls deep into a world of alcoholism, casual sex, and denial. After frequent conflicts with their mother, Colette, Jimmy's older sister, leaves the home to marry her sweetheart. Jimmy is left to decide to stay and support his mother and younger brother Vincent or leave town as well. As he wrestles with a decision, Jimmy stumbles upon a small town about 15 miles away from his own and is exposed to a very diverse group of extraordinary people. He is humbled by their generosity, but reluctant to accept them for their differences. Until tragedy strikes. It will be up to Jimmy to find a way to save the only group of people who have given him an opportunity to better his life. Along with his mother Agnes, Jimmy finds the strength and hope to redeem his past relationships and forgive his mother for her short comings. This is a story of hope, a story of struggle, but a story of how, as humans, we each have the instinct of good. Sometimes it just takes a fresh perspective of the world around us.—Donna G.

synopsis: A decade after the events of the first film, Doctor Arthur Neuman is giving a tour of the hall of Norse mythology in Edge City's local museum. Neuman mentions that Loki, the God of Mischief, created the mask and unleashed it on Earth in order to spread his chaos among mankind, and that those who wear the mask are granted his powers. When Neuman brings up Loki's punishment and imprisonment at Odin's hands, a stranger suddenly becomes furious and transforms, revealing himself to be Loki. The tourists panic and flee, but Neuman stays to argue with Loki, who takes the mask in the display case, only to realize it is a replica. In anger, he removes Neuman's face from his body and puts it in the case, before disposing of the arriving authorities and storming out of the museum in a rage.Meanwhile, the real mask makes its way to Fringe City and is found in a river by a dog named Otis - who belongs to Tim Avery, an aspiring animator at an animation studio, who is reluctant to accept parenthood with his wife, Tonya. On a tropical island, Loki is relaxing until Odin confronts and orders him to resume the search for the mask he had sent him on, as he believes it has caused too much chaos for mankind. Loki asks his father to help him, only for the latter to sternly say that he has to take responsibility for his actions. Later that night, Tim puts on the mask for a Halloween party held at the studio, becoming an eccentric, green-faced party animal. When the party turns out to be a bore, Tim uses his newfound powers to perform a remix of "Can't Take My Eyes Off You", making the party a success and giving Tim's boss, Daniel Moss, the inspiration for a new cartoon, resulting in his promotion the next day.Tim returns to his house that night and, while still wearing the mask, conceives a baby. The baby, Alvey, is born with the same powers as the mask, which alerts Odin. Possessing a store clerk, Odin informs Loki about this and tells him that if he finds the child, he will find the mask. Months later, Tonya goes on a business trip, leaving Tim with their son. Tim, now promoted, desperately tries to work on his cartoon at home, but is continuously disrupted by Alvey. In order to get some peace and quiet, Tim lets Alvey watch various cartoons on television. Alvey, whose intelligence is amplified by the mask, devilishly comes up with the idea to torment his father using his powers. Meanwhile, Otis, who has been feeling neglected by Tim because of Alvey, dons the mask by accident and becomes a wild version of himself, who tries to get rid of Alvey, but all of his attempts are foiled by the much craftier infant.Eventually, Loki, after searching from home to home for the baby and leaving a trail of mayhem in his wake, finds Alvey and confronts Tim for the mask back, but Alvey uses his powers to protect his father. Odin, possessing Tim's body, becomes fed up with Loki's destructive approach for defying him once again and strips his son of his powers. Tim is later fired after failing to impress Moss during a pitch, but is able to reconcile and bond with Alvey. Loki, still determined to please his father, sneaks into the Avery household that night and manages to complete a summoning ritual and appeal to Odin to restore his powers. Odin agrees, but only for a limited time, stating this as his last chance. Loki then kidnaps Alvey in exchange for the mask. When Tonya returns home, she goes with Tim and Otis, whom Tim had apologized to for his negligence towards him and convinced him that Alvey could be his new best friend, to make the exchange with Loki, but Loki decides to keep Alvey despite the exchange, forcing the group to chase after them as Tim becomes the Mask once more. The subsequent confrontation is relatively evenly matched due to both of them possessing equal powers, prompting Loki to halt the fight, and suggest that they should let Alvey decide who he wants to be with. Although Loki tries to lure Alvey to him with promises of fun, Tim takes the mask off and convinces his son to choose him using the connection he had forged with him.Saddened and enraged, Loki tries to kill Tim, but his time runs out and Odin appears in person, once again scolding Loki for his failure. Tim, however, feels sympathy for Loki and reminds Odin that regardless of their problems, they will still be family and nothing is more important than that. Touched by Tim's speech as the mask is returned, Odin reconciles with Loki and the duo return home. Some time later, Tim is rehired when his subsequent cartoon, based on his own experiences of Alvey and Otis competing for his attention, becomes a success. After the Avery family watches the cartoon's premiere, Tonya reveals that she is pregnant again.
summary: When the Take-its steal this year's supply of Easter Eggs, an unlikely group of characters band together and brave the perils of taking back what is rightfully theirs. These richly defined characters form deep bonds of friendship throughout their journey and discover how to face their fears. synopsis:
"Perfectionist control freak... Boundary pusher... Enfant terrible... Driven taskmaster...." Much can be said about Chef Charlie Trotter, the self-proclaimed "excellence-ist," who reimagined haute American cuisine and made Chicago the culinary capital it is today. Charlie was a rock star among the first generation of celebrity chefs, but because he rose to prominence in the pre-social media era, his legacy stands to be lost to time.
For 25 years, Charlie and his diverse team that hailed from all over Chicago and elsewhere improvised 10-course tasting menus, never serving the same dish twice. The self-taught chef was credited with inventing micro-greens and took vegetarianism mainstream, and the groundbreaking style of photography in his cookbooks made him the godfather of food porn. Charlie's obsession with exceptional ingredients and his exacting management style drew ambitious aspiring chefs to his door, and his flock of trainees have become the who's who of the culinary world.
To his employees, Chef Charlie Trotter was an enigmatic guru. To the media, he was a caricature of an overbearing perfectionist. But to those who loved him, he was "Chuck," a fun-loving dreamer whose passion knew no bounds. LOVE, CHARLIE reveals how, over the course of his career, Chuck (his authentic self) gave way to Charlie (his professional persona), with devastating consequences.
Told through intimate sit-down interviews with family, friends and celebrated chefs including Wolfgang Puck,
Emeril Lagasse and Grant Achatz, along with extensive personal archival material (including 8mm home movies
and hundreds of pieces of personal correspondence), and evocative graphics and animation- the film is a searing portrait of what happens when a person's identity becomes intrinsically tied to their work and an epic cautionary tale of what can happen when that work fades away.
summary: Charlie Trotter revolutionized American cuisine but his quest for excellence cost him everything. Featuring Grant Achatz, Emeril Lagasse, and Wolfgang Puck.

She left home, left the state with Martina a Madam that she had met. Wanting to live the lavish lifestyle she jumped into the fast life of stripping and prostitution. So much occurred during her new fast lifestyle, so many experiences good and bad. Still life had other plans and luck seemed to never be on her side. She faces a life or death situation when she's kidnapped... Base off True Story - "Hell In My Life- The Stacey Staxx Story."—Angel Williams

synopsis:
The film narrates the most horrible torture that these men preferred to suffer before negotiating with the Castro regime. Plantados is directed by the well-known director Lilo Vilaplana, the feature film has two story lines; a current one in Miami where an elderly political prisoner lives who discovers a henchman who tortures him in prison; and he begins from that perspective to see all the abuses that were committed in those prisons.
This movie will show what really happens in Cuban prisons, and what for the Director means "to do historical justice, which is to do justice to these men who were forgotten in those prisons, who were mistreated, who were harassed by the Castro regime and the world has turned its back , in silence, nobody was listening, and there are many people involved in this "."We want to capture the essence of the Plantados, their indomitable spirit, their resistance, their persistence and their courage in the face of the Castro regime" Vilaplana said in a room where a handyman was recreating the cells of the La Cabaña prison, adding layers of cement to make it look like the walls of the ancient Spanish fortress that was turned into a terrifying prison for Cuba's political prisoners."Plantados" boasts a million-dollar budget provided by Leopoldo Fernandez Pujals, a Cuban-born businessman who became wealthy in Spain with his Telepizza chain.Fernández Pujals provided the funds to honor the memory of Cuban political prisoners and especially his uncle, José Pujals Mederos, who served 27 years of a 30-year sentence imposed by the Castro government. Pujals Mederos died in March in Tallahassee.
summary: The film narrates the most horrible tortures that political prisoners "Plantados" received from the Castro regime.

synopsis:
Sixty-five-year-old Joe Amable-Amo is struggling with his faith as his three-year-old granddaughter and her father have just died. The former amateur golf champion is besieged by the malaise of encroaching older age, working as a bank executive, gearing up for retirement, deep concern for his wife's unanswered needs, his humanitarian daughter's survival, and a potentially lethal loss of faith. But, at his nadir, in his office one afternoon, a voice speaks to him via his computer monitor.
What does a syncopated voice--claiming to be God Almighty--have in mind for Joe?
This ostensible God has chosen Joe to deliver a message to the world; it's this: The seemingly impossible is possible. The God voice tells Joe he is going to play in the World Entire golf championship, and if he can renew his faith powerfully enough, he will win.
Well, first and foremost, God wants Joe to meet his guide, his Virgil. Except his Virgil is an incredibly quirky man named Herb. And he's a museum of tattoos and he drives a motorcycle and he makes golf clubs and promises Joe that he will help him regain the ability of his youth. If Joe will trust, not Herb, not God, but himself.
And so, Joe and Herb set out on a journey of contention, of doubt, of setbacks that through Joe's burgeoning faith in himself and the earthy wisdom of Herb turns his world upside down and then, in an act of outrageous selflessness, of stupefying generosity that turns his--and our--world very much right side up.
When Herb roars away in the last minute of our journey, he leaves standing like a fortress of love and faith the family Amable-Amo--Joe, Sheila, their daughter Audrey, and by extension, everyone they touch.
summary: Sixty-five-year-old Joe Amable-Amo thinks nothing much in his background distinguishes him from other guys his age. He is struggling with his faith after tragedy hits. As the former amateur golfer's life continues to unfold, Joe is besieged with his marriage, working as a bank executive, and gearing up for retirement. But as he is about to discover, life has a way of throwing a curveball that changes everything. Joe is working at his desk when he receives a message from God on his computer screen that tells him he has been chosen to deliver an inspirational message to the world that the seemingly impossible is possible. God tells Joe he is going to play in World Entire golf championship, and if his faith is strong enough, he will win. As Joe embarks on a spiritual journey along with God's personal messenger and motorcyclist, Herb, Joe learns to make a difference, he must learn to face his fears, have confidence in his abilities, and commit to God before he can succeed.

synopsis: In New York City, Canal Street divides Little Italy and Chinatown, and a bridge separates Manhattan from Brooklyn. But they don't stop a turf war from erupting among Italian and Chinese organized crime syndicates. There's Manhattan mob boss Al Capella (Tony Darrow: Goodfellas), Brooklyn mob boss Amador Condimento (Vincent Pastore: The Sopranos), and Chinatown Triad boss Hung Phat (Lo Meng: Ip Man 2). They're all involved in the underbelly of the condiments trade. The illegal trafficking of oils, spices, and herbs has been around for centuries, begun by the great Italian explorer Marco Polo-and its very serious business for these crime families. Recently, they've been trying to move in on each other's turf and tensions are high. And when a Chinese guy starts poking around and tries to join the MOB, the double-crossing begins. Despite being Chinese, young "Vinny" Chow (Jay Kwon: The Punisher) embarks on a personal quest to join the Italian mob so he can get the Italian girl of his dreams, Tina Di Pocco, who only dates Wiseguys. In his many attempts to prove himself mob-worthy, Vinny is drawn into a web of intrigue instigated by New York's dirty crime commissioner Sean O'Greedy (Raymond J. Barry: The 100), who is playing all the mob bosses against one another. Along with his friends Joey Risotto and Lawrence, Vinny is recruited by special agents Johnson and Johnson to infiltrate the mob. He must impersonate The DON to gather evidence that could take down the entire New York Crime Syndicate once and for all. The title "Made in Chinatown" is a play on the phrase "Made in China" and the Italian Mafia's notion of being "Made." And so Vinny Chow literally is, "Made in Chinatown."
summary: Goodfellas meets Ip Man when a young Chinese nobody sets out to become a Don in the Italian Mafia. It turns out that earning respect, finding love, and discovering his identity doesn't come so easy. He'll have to fight his way to the top.

summary: Dawn Goldie is a painter who seemingly has the perfect life. Dawn's obsession with the book causes her to neglect her business and home life, which doesn't sit well with Alex, who chastises her and attempts to confiscate the book. Alex, who has his own agenda, bombards Dawn with requests to fund his latest business venture, but she declines his request and Alex begins to lose patience with her. Dawn, oblivious to Alex's secret plans, becomes more engrossed in the novel, which is eerily familiar to the life of her best friend. synopsis: When Pepe "Joe" Aguilar teamed up with his longtime friend and former film producer Marco-Antonio to help assist in navigating the treacherous waters of Hollywood in search of the best deal for Joe's sure to be Oscar award winning screenplay, he had no idea what was in store. Joe's lifelong dream of becoming a respected screenwriter seemed within reach. Joe was an outsider in "LaLa Land," and Marco-Antonio moved fast, calling on all connections and getting the word out on the success of Joe's script in the film festival circuit. Meetings were set and "off-the-record" offers looked promising. Joe's struggles seemed to be a thing of the past... Now it was a waiting game, and Joe was champing at the bit. On an Uber fare which Joe often drove to make ends-meet, Joe meets a pair of independent film makers whom seemed to tell Joe what he already knew. "Why sell when you can own" is what they preached. This got Joe thinking... The days of Hollywood studios monopolizing the distribution game, holding all the cards and making the lion's share off creative's like Joe, were now a thing of the past and Joe knew this to be true... A meeting was set with just Joe and the two filmmakers and Joe was ready to move. Without Marco-Antonio's savvy Hollywood sense, Joe soon found himself agreeing and signing a "partnership" contract which ultimately leads to zero ownership. When Joe realized his script was no longer his, he was devastated. The decades of endless writing sessions and sacrifice were gone. How would Joe break the catastrophic news to his family and his biggest supporter, his wife Elizabeth? Greed had gotten the best of Joe, and with nowhere to turn, Joe confides in Memo, a fellow employee and friend at a restaurant where the two worked. Memo takes pity on Joe and recommends having his Tio look into helping him. His Tio Armando is a respected businessman and great problem solver. A desperate Joe is all in, and even offers to split whatever the script sells for with Armando. Tio Armando comes through and gets Joe the rights to the script back. However, a miscommunication has Joe owing Armando a large sum of money for which Joe does not have... Unfortunately for Joe, Tio Armando is actually Armando "El Muerto" Ochoa, the most ruthless drug lord walking the earth... Now Joe must contend with Armando, and Armando has plans for Joe since they're now "partners." Wealthy people want to be famous, and famous People want to be wealthy. Armando "El Muerto" Ochoa has all the wealth he desires, now the world needs to know how and why...
summary: When a down-on-his luck father of three has Hollywood buzzing over his screenplay, it's a matter of time before all his dreams come true. The year is 1941 and a young woman, Kate Kensington, struggles with the loss of her fiancee who was stationed at Pearl Harbor. Due to the tragic loss she falls into severe depression. Her parents, Freda and Dr. Robert Kensington II M.D., have placed her into a mental institution for treatment. While Kate is at the asylum she receives various forms of treatment; however, things begin to slowly spiral out of control as Kate slips further into psychosis. After nine months of unsuccessful treatments at Dunning Mental Asylum, Kate is released into her family's care. On October 31, 1942, Kate Kensington puts on her wedding dress, walks out of the Kensington Estate and into the woods and is never seen again. A massive twenty-two day search was conducted by the Citrus County Sheriff's Department without a single clue to Kate's whereabouts. In a statement by Captain Donald Harper, "This has been a tough case for all of us to endure. We are confident with the aggressive search we have conducted Kate is not longer in the vicinity. This case will remain open and our thoughts and prayers go out to the Kensington Family". THE LEGEND BEGINS... There has been speculation over Kate's disappearance which has fueled many rumors and stories throughout the years. There have been several eye witness accounts documented. Kate has been seen around the Kensington Estate, Hills of Rest Cemetery and the wooded trails. THE LEGEND GROWS... The Legend of Kate Kensington grew. Each passing year new stories emerged along with new sightings of Kate's ghostly apparition. Many of the claims were made by very respected people in the small town of Inverness. The stories, the folklore, the legend would continue to grow for the next seventy-two years. Throughout all the stories the one question remained, "What ever happened to Kate Kensington?" THE LEGEND BECOMES A REALITY... Present day, a photo has surfaced by a respected local photographer, Ralph White. The photo shows what appears to be a ghostly apparition walking among the Hills of Rest Cemetery grounds. The story breaks when the photo is placed on the front page of the newspaper as a morning news crew reports the story on location at the Hills of Rest Cemetery. The excitement escalates as three close friends go on a quest to discover the truth and they begin to unravel the mystery of: "The Legend Of Kate Kensington"
